attributes.action: Companies must let customers cancel subscriptions online
attributes.additional_details:
This is clearly a marketing strategy as it makes it very easy to subscribe and harder to unsubscribe. Companies that I know that do this: The Guardian, Virgin Media.
Other countries have already solved this (e.g. California: https://www.cnet.com/news/companies-must-let-customers-cancel-subscriptions-online-california-law-says/)
attributes.background:
There are an increasing number of services that can be either joined or upgraded online, but cannot be canceled online. Sometimes they do offer a phone option, but that is not the same.
I think that if you can subscribe to something online you should be able to unsubscribe online

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for individual companies.
